intro: Hemicyclia andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman island bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
